question_sentence: A powerful cyclone hit Myanmar this week. What was its name?
evidence: Cyclone Mocha barreled into Myanmar’s coast days ago, collapsing houses, bringing down telephone poles and severely compromising communication lines in conflict-racked Rakhine state.

question_sentence: According to sources, the spy balloon that was shot down over the US earlier this year was able to transmit information back to which country in real time?
evidence: The balloon was able to transmit information back to Beijing in real time, a source told CNN, and the US government still does not know for sure whether the Chinese government could wipe the balloon’s data as it received it.

question_sentence: Which country is set to become the 29th African nation to abolish the death penalty?
evidence: The West African country’s parliament has voted to abolish the death penalty, offering an expected reprieve for 176 condemned prisoners. If President Nana Akufo-Addo assents to the new law, Ghana will become the 124th nation in the world to outlaw the penalty.

question_sentence: Cranberry sauce is a holiday staple. How many pounds of cranberries do Americans consume during Thanksgiving week?
evidence: Americans consume 80 million pounds of cranberries during Thanksgiving week and nearly 400 million pounds total per year – mostly in the form of juice or juice blends.

question_sentence: True or false: LIV golfers are allowed to compete at this week’s Masters Tournament.
Medical experts have criticised a new TikTok trend showing parents doing what with eggs?
choices: Daring teenagers to swallow them whole
evidence: The videos, many of which use the hashtag #eggprank, are getting millions of views, but many of the children look “upset and stunned”, said Sky News. Medical experts have also warned of the risk of salmonella.

question_sentence: Video footage of a large brawl on a boat dock captivated the internet this week. Where did the fight occur?
evidence: At least three people have been charged in connection with a brawl at a riverfront dock in Montgomery, Alabama. The fight between the men, identified by authorities as White, and a Black co-captain of a riverboat, has turned a spotlight on the city’s racial history.

question_sentence: Customs agents at a Minnesota airport seized a box of giraffe poo from a woman who wanted to use the droppings to make what?
evidence: The unnamed Iowa woman, who was returning from Kenya, declared the small box of poo and explained her plan after her belongings were inspected at Minneapolis-Saint Paul airport. She told officials that she had previously made a necklace with moose faeces, but the border protection agency destroyed the giraffe droppings, citing their potential to spread disease.

question_sentence: Which public figure will plead guilty to federal tax charges?
evidence: Hunter Biden, the son of President Joe Biden, will plead guilty to two tax misdemeanors and struck a deal with federal prosecutors to resolve a felony gun charge, the Justice Department said Tuesday in court filings. As part of the plea agreement, the DOJ has agreed to recommend a sentence of probation for the two counts of failing to pay taxes in a timely matter for the years 2017 and 2018, according to sources.

question_sentence: Sweden is building the world’s largest what?
evidence: The “world’s largest urban construction project in wood” will be built in Stockholm, announced Sweden, which could pave the way for similar structures in the future. Although the plan could be more sustainable than traditional construction, there are concerns about potential fire hazards. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Racism, sexism, elitism and classism is prevalent at every level in which English sport, according to a new independent report?
evidence: A two-year investigation by the Independent Commission for Equity in Cricket found that racism was “entrenched” in the “elitist and exclusionary” sport, while women were “frequently demeaned, stereotyped and treated as second-class”.

question_sentence: How many Republican candidates participated in the presidential debate this week?
evidence: Five presidential candidates met the criteria to participate in Wednesday’s third primary debate in Miami. Former President Trump, the party’s front-runner, skipped the debate.

question_sentence: What was the focus of the latest referendum for the Appoquinimink School District?
What is the name of the BBC's controversial new drama about Jimmy Savile?
evidence: The four-part drama stars Steve Coogan as the serial sex predator and examines how Savile got away with his crimes. Coogan is being praised for his performance, but some critics have questioned the purpose of the dramatisation, which premiered on BBC One and iPlayer on Monday.

question_sentence: The U.S. Senate confirmed confirmed historian and political scientist Colleen Shogan to head which federal agency?
Which company this week agreed to pay more than $30 million to settle privacy complaints?
evidence: Amazon agreed to pay a hefty sum to settle privacy complaints over its Alexa voice assistant and Ring doorbell cameras. The settlements with the Federal Trade Commission highlight claims that the company retained Ring videos and Alexa voice recordings for years.

question_sentence: Who won this year's Nobel Peace Prize?
evidence: The jailed Iranian women's rights activist was awarded the prize this week for her fight against the oppression of women in the country, and for her efforts in promoting human rights and freedom for all. The Nobel committee's decision to honour Mohammadi was widely applauded, but the awards have also triggered controversies over the years.

question_sentence: Which sports brand faced a backlash after claiming its £45 trainers for babies "help promote natural foot development"?
evidence: The sports giant claims its Swoosh 1 trainers "can help promote natural foot development", but experts said "the necessity of wearing trainers is questionable" for babies. For more stories from the stranger side of life, subscribe to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which carrier is merging with Alaska Airlines?
evidence: Alaska Airlines announced it will buy rival Hawaiian Airlines for $1.9 billion. The unique deal will see both companies keep their existing brands.

question_sentence: The FBI this week said people should avoid using which public technology?
evidence: The FBI warned people against using public phone charging stations in order to avoid exposing their devices to malicious software.

question_sentence: The House of Representatives passed a bill this week to suspend the nation’s debt limit through which date?
evidence: The House voted overwhelmingly on Wednesday to pass a bill to suspend the nation’s debt limit through January 1, 2025, as lawmakers race to prevent a catastrophic default.

question_sentence: Secretary of State Antony Blinken traveled to which country this week in an effort to “stabilize” relations?
evidence: Blinken traveled to China for meetings with top officials, including President Xi Jinping. Blinken is the first US secretary of state to visit Beijing in five years, and his talks were seen as a key litmus test for whether the two governments can stop relations from continuing to deteriorate at a time of lingering distrust.

question_sentence: What was one of the proposed solutions to address concerns about safety in New Castle County's parks?
choices: Increasing the number of park events
Enhancing the permitting process for overcrowded parks

question_sentence: The House of Representatives has been in disarray following the ousting of speaker Kevin McCarthy. Who did House Republicans pick as their nominee for speaker this week?
evidence: GOP lawmakers selected Steve Scalise as their nominee for the job by a narrow margin as feuds within the House Republican Party threatened to plunge the chamber even deeper into chaos. However, Scalise withdrew his bid for speaker late Thursday after House Republicans failed to coalesce behind him.

question_sentence: NASCAR suspended which driver after it said they intentionally wrecked Denny Hamlin during the Coca-Cola 600?
Cell phones blared to life at 4:45 a.m. ET in Florida with an emergency alert detailing:
choices: A test of the alert system
A group of alligators on the loose

question_sentence: While many US industries have recovered from the Covid-19 pandemic, which major sector still has a huge shortage of workers?
evidence: The leisure and hospitality industry is struggling to recover all the workers it lost due to the pandemic, recent data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics shows. This sector has the biggest shortage of workers, down 349,000 people, or 2% of the total pre-pandemic workforce.

question_sentence: Which city this week elected its first female mayor?
evidence: CNN projects Democrat Donna Deegan will become Jacksonville’s first female mayor. This marks only the second time in 30 years that a Democrat will win the office in Florida’s most populous city.

question_sentence: What type of cheese does President Biden order on his cheese steak at the historic Claymont Steak Shop?
Which potentially harmful ingredient has been banned from use in all California foods?
evidence: California has banned the use of four potentially harmful chemicals in food, including the common color additive red dye No. 3. This chemical is found in thousands of products and many popular candies.

question_sentence: Which Supreme Court justice – already in hot water over gifts from a donor – was found to have claimed income from a defunct real estate firm?
Which celebrity will host the 2024 Academy Awards?
evidence: Comedian Jimmy Kimmel will be returning to host the Oscars for the fourth time.

question_sentence: In an unprecedented court appearance, former President Donald Trump was arraigned this week on how many criminal charges?
evidence: Former President Donald Trump pleaded not guilty to 34 felony criminal charges of falsifying business records in Manhattan criminal court Tuesday.

question_sentence: Thousands of people were recently stranded at which festival?
evidence: Around 70,000 Burning Man attendees were stranded in the Nevada desert following intense rain and muddy conditions.

question_sentence: What inspired Thomas Jackson to start his clothing line, "Carry My Own Weight"?
choices: A challenge to prove his friends wrong.
A childhood dream of owning a business.

question_sentence: Who ended Max Verstappen’s 10-race winning streak by claiming victory at the Singapore Grand Prix?
evidence: The Spanish racing ace claimed victory for Ferrari by narrowly beating his close friend and former McLaren teammate Norris to the finish line in the streets of Singapore on Sunday. Verstappen trailed in fifth position, behind Leclerc and Hamilton.

question_sentence: A new study found that which UK city is the “gloomiest” in the UK?
evidence: Research by Betway found that the West Yorkshire city was the least sunny in the UK, followed by. Blackpool and Aberdeen.

question_sentence: What sparked the popularity of Mexican pizza in Philadelphia?
choices: A chef's nostalgic return to his Italian restaurant roots
A local food competition promoting creative pizza recipes
The fusion of Mexican and Italian flavors by innovative chefs
The influence of Mexican-American fast-food chains

question_sentence: What is one of the changes that Delaware Park's $10 million renovation project includes?
choices: Renovating the racetrack and sports betting areas
Adding a new area for high-limit table games
Closing down the casino during renovations
Reducing the number of slot machines

question_sentence: Which major city has been warned it must stop building skyscrapers and high-rise buildings or it could “sink”, according to a new study?
evidence: New York must stop building skyscrapers or it will sink, a new study has warned. There are thought to be one million buildings in New York City, weighing an estimated 771 million tonnes, and the study, headed by Tom Parsons of the United States Geological Survey, found that the city is “plopping closer” to the water at a rate of 1 to 2mm a year, “with some areas subsiding much faster”, said the New York Post. Lower Manhattan is particularly at risk, and there is heightened concern for both Brooklyn and Queens.

question_sentence: Harry Belafonte, a trailblazing activist, actor and singer, died this week at age 96. He was the first Black man to receive which award?
Baseball star Shohei Ohtani signed a record-breaking $700 million contract with which US team?
evidence: Ohtani is the highest-paid player in MLB history after signing the 10-year contract, following the expiration of his contract with the Los Angeles Angels. The Japanese star has agreed to defer $680 million of his historic pay deal until 2034, so that his new team has more cash to enlist other new players.

question_sentence: Which fruit crop in Georgia has been severely impacted by extreme winter weather?
evidence: The Peach State lost 90% of its staple fruit crop this year after abnormally warm winter weather and a late-season freeze, researchers say.

question_sentence: A member of which band said he used artificial intelligence to create his iconic group's "last record"?
Which cruise line recently had a ship battered by an intense storm that left water and objects flowing down interior hallways?
evidence: The cruise ship Carnival Sunshine was rocked by a storm that caused interior water damage and delayed its return to port in South Carolina.

question_sentence: Who is the new speaker of the US House of Representatives?
evidence: Following three weeks of infighting, the Republican-led House finally elected the little-known Louisiana congressman on Wednesday as the 56th speaker, replacing ousted California Republican Kevin McCarthy. Johnson, a close ally of Donald Trump, has acknowledged the challenges of his new office, stressing the need to "unify our membership and build consensus" across the GOP.

question_sentence: Drive-in movies were a popular summer pastime in the ‘50s and ‘60s. When did the first drive-in movie theater open in the US?
evidence: The Camden Drive-In in Camden, New Jersey opened in June of 1933. The price of admission was 25 cents for the car and 25 cents per person.

question_sentence: Which professional golfer won the 2023 Masters Tournament?
evidence: Jon Rahm won the 2023 Masters Tournament on Sunday at Augusta National Golf Club, clinching his first green jacket and second career major.

question_sentence: What was the final score of the football game between Delaware and Penn State?
A row erupted over Bradley Cooper’s prosthetic nose in an upcoming biopic about which Jewish composer?
evidence: The teaser trailer for “Maestro”, about the legendary creator of “West Side Story”, shows star Cooper wearing a prominent prosthetic nose. The actor, who also directed and co-produced the Netflix biopic, was accused of “Jewface” – when a non-Jewish actor plays a Jewish person and exaggerates so-called “Jewish” characteristics.

question_sentence: Which actor paid tribute to Karl Lagerfeld by wearing a giant fluffy cat costume to the 2023 Met Gala?
evidence: Leto dressed up as Legerfeld’s famed cat Choupette for the gala in New York on Monday, which was themed on the late fashion designer.

question_sentence: As Russia’s war in Ukraine raged, a mercenary group attempted an insurrection against President Vladimir Putin. The Wagner Group’s leader later died in a plane crash. What was his name?
evidence: Yevgeny Prigozhin was among 10 people killed in a plane crash several weeks after the Wagner Group’s uprising.

question_sentence: Which highly anticipated Netflix show is halting filming due to the film and TV writers’ strike?
evidence: Plans for filming the fifth and final season of “Stranger Things” has been paused due to the writers’ strike, the show’s co-creators announced.

question_sentence: Ancient graves believed to have belonged to Knights Templar from the 12th century have been rediscovered in which English county?
evidence: Historian Edward Spencer Dyas said eight ancient graves in the churchyard of St Mary’s, in Enville, Staffordshire, could belong to Knights Templar, members of a medieval religious military order. The researcher said the discovery means the 12th-century church could be “one of the most nationally important churches in the country”

question_sentence: Catholic nuns in which US state have banned their bishop from their monastery for their “spiritual safety”?
evidence: The Discalced Carmelite Nuns of Arlington said they “no longer recognise the authority” of Bishop Michael Olson, who they accuse of aggression and spiritual manipulation. The long-running row began when he accused their Mother Prioress of violating her vow of chastity by “sexting” a priest.

question_sentence: Legendary Canadian folk singer Gordon Lightfoot died this week at 84. Finish the title of one of his hit songs: The Wreck of the ...
Which movie cleaned up at the Oscars by winning seven awards, including Best Picture?
evidence: “Everything Everywhere All at Once,” an eccentric science-fiction tale, was a hit with critics and moviegoers. Michelle Yeoh won an Oscar for Best Actress.

question_sentence: 2. Elon Musk's X is suing which organisation for defamation over reports of ads on the platform appearing next to antisemitic posts?
evidence: In a lawsuit filed on Monday, Musk accused the media watchdog of defaming X, formerly known as Twitter, after companies including Apple, IBM and Disney pulled adverts from the platform following reports of antisemitic content. Media Matters, which stood by its reporting, is accused of manipulating algorithms "to bypass safeguards and create images of X's largest advertisers' paid posts adjacent to racist, incendiary content".

question_sentence: Why will Winter WonderFest not be opening this year, according to the news article?
choices: Financial challenges led to the closure
It was not popular with the community
The event organizers wanted to change its location

question_sentence: What is the title of Jodi Johnson's podcast, in which he shares his personal experiences and battles with mental health issues to spread awareness and provide self-help tips?
HBO's "Succession," which aired its series finale this week, centers on the (fictional) Roy family, the owners of what company?
What type of weather event caused the damage to parts of northwest Delaware this week?
Why did Sanjay Bhatnagar receive recognition as one of Delaware's top lawyers shortly after losing his lawsuit appeal against New Castle County?
choices: It was a coincidence unrelated to his lawsuit.
He was recognized for his contributions to the Hindu religion.
The county attorney's office nominated him for the award.
The award was given to him to compensate for his legal fees.

question_sentence: Which bizarre limited-edition flavor did Skittles debut this week?
evidence: Skittles’ newest flavor doesn’t taste like the rainbow — it tastes like mustard.

question_sentence: Which city was enveloped in a blanket of toxic smog this week?
evidence: A toxic haze in the Indian capital of New Delhi reached hazardous levels for several consecutive days this week. The airborne particle pollution reached PM 2.5 — a concentration nearly 80 times the World Health Organization’s recommended limit.

question_sentence: What necessitated the rescue of the man whose boat overturned in the Delaware River near Reedy Island?
choices: The boat may have been struck by another vessel
Inadequate safety equipment on the boat

question_sentence: The CDC this week announced it will no longer distribute which item?
evidence: The CDC is no longer distributing Covid-19 vaccination cards, the white cards that were given out with vaccines earlier in the pandemic.

question_sentence: Which MLB team won the World Series this week?
evidence: The Texas Rangers won their first World Series title in franchise history, defeating the Arizona Diamondbacks.

question_sentence: In a two-year study, what dangerous sea creatures were observed by researchers swimming safely in very close proximity to humans?
How many people will get a universal basic income (UBI) of £1,600 a month in a proposed trial in England?
evidence: If the two-year pilot programme secures funding, volunteers to receive UBI will be selected at random from Jarrow in South Tyneside and East Finchley in north London, and 20% of places will be reserved for people with disabilities.

question_sentence: Which county in Delaware saw the most damage from the recent East Coast storm?
Horror movie "Five Nights at Freddy's" broke box-office records by earning how much in its opening weekend?
evidence: The adaptation of the popular 2014 video game earned $78 million domestically and a further $52 million in other countries worldwide, despite getting poor reviews and being released simultaneously on the Peacock streaming service. According to makers Universal and Blumhouse, the movie broke a string of box-office records including the biggest Halloween weekend opening of all time.

question_sentence: What aspect of Jamin Pugh's legacy was recently honored in Laurel, Delaware?
choices: His achievements as a professional wrestler
His accomplishments in the music industry

question_sentence: In which Netflix anime series does Aubrey Plaza voice the character Julie Powers?
Who served as George Washington’s vice president?
evidence: John Adams served as the first vice president of the US under George Washington and later served one term as the second president of the US.

question_sentence: Which streaming giant warned its U.S. subscribers this week that it's cracking down on password-sharing with people outside their household?
Twitter’s famous blue bird logo has been replaced by what image in what is thought to be a late April Fool’s Day prank by billionaire owner Elon Musk?
evidence: On Monday, Twitter users noted that the blue bird logo usually found on Twitter’s homepage and loading screen has now been replaced with an image of Doge, the Shiba Inu dog used as a popular internet meme.

question_sentence: The Indian government controversially decided to limit the export of what foodstuff?
evidence: India, which supplies about 40% of the world’s rice exports, took the unprecedented step of banning the export of non-basmati white rice, in an effort to curb domestic inflation. But the move is likely to push up prices all over the world.

question_sentence: Which popular Christmas song topped the Billboard Hot 100 chart for the first time this week?
choices: “All I Want for Christmas Is You”
evidence: Sixty-five years after it was first released, “Rockin’ Around the Christmas Tree” has topped the Billboard Hot 100 for the first time. That makes the hit song’s original performer, Brenda Lee, now 78, one of the oldest artists to ever top the chart.

question_sentence: Which country is banning all seafood from Japan?
evidence: China is banning all seafood from Japan in response to Tokyo’s decision to begin releasing treated radioactive water from the Fukushima nuclear plant.

question_sentence: Experts estimate that how many of around two million Britons with long Covid are in need of specialist care?
evidence: According to The Mirror, experts at the UK’s first long Covid clinic, at University College Hospital London, estimate that hundreds of thousands of patients are in need of specialist care for ailments ranging from severe fatigue to brain fog. But “so far only 100,000 have been offered treatment”, the paper reported.

question_sentence: Dominion Voting Systems settled with which TV network in a defamation lawsuit over the broadcast of lies after the 2020 presidential election?
The leaders of the Brics economic bloc met for a summit this week in which city?
evidence: The three-day summit was billed as the most important in a decade for the Brics bloc, comprising Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. Tensions have been mounting among the group, which together make up 40% of the world’s population, as China pushes for an expanded bloc to challenge the G7.

question_sentence: What is the main theme of Rockwood's upcoming event, the "Goth Ball: A Night at Rockwood"?
choices: An art exhibition at the Biggs Museum

question_sentence: Rock & Roll Hall of Fame icon Tina Turner died this week at 83. Which one of these was not one of her songs?
choices: "What’s Love Got to Do With It"
"To Know Him Is to Love Him"

question_sentence: What type of agreement was reached between dozens of countries this week?
evidence: The world agreed to a new climate deal in Dubai on Wednesday at the COP28 summit after two weeks of painstaking talks. The agreement marks the first time the annual UN meeting has asked countries to move away from fossil fuels — the main driver of the climate crisis.

question_sentence: The latest data shows that abortion rates in Scotland increased by how much between 2021 and 2022?
evidence: The number of women aged 16 to 19 accessing abortions in Scotland in 2021-22 rose to its highest level since data was first published in 2013. Experts have said that social media misinformation and the cost-of-living crisis contributed to the record-high figures.

question_sentence: Liz Truss is facing a bill from the government for how much relating to her use of a grace-and-favour country home?
evidence: The former prime minister is contesting the bill for costs incurred at Chevening House in Kent during her tenure as foreign secretary. The costs reportedly include food, wine and missing items, but Truss says the vast majority of the invoice relates to official government business, for which she would not be liable, rather than personal expenses.

question_sentence: West Virginia suspended men's basketball coach Bob Huggins for three games and cut his salary after he did what?
choices: Used a homophobic slur on the radio
Told a player to fake an injury
Made an obscene gesture on TV

question_sentence: Who is Wally, and why did he attend the Philadelphia Flyers' game against the Carolina Hurricanes?
choices: Wally is the Flyers' new mascot who was introduced at the game.
Wally is a professional hockey player for the Flyers.
Wally is an emotional support alligator who attended the game with his owner, Joseph Henney.
Wally is a popular singer who performed at the game's halftime show.

question_sentence: Who was named sportswoman of the year at the 2023 Laureus World Sports Awards?
evidence: The 36-year-old Jamaican sprinter beat a field that included swimmer Katie Ledecky, tennis star Iga Świątek and 400m hurdles record-holder Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone. Lionel Messi was named sportsman of the year at the awards in Paris on Monday.

question_sentence: Which country has acted as a mediator in the Israel-Hamas conflict that began this year?
evidence: The small Persian Gulf state of Qatar played a key role in efforts to mediate deals to free hostages taken by Hamas, as well as evacuate foreign nationals from Gaza.

question_sentence: America’s banking system was widely impacted this week by which issue?
evidence: Since last week, frustrated customers have reported direct deposit payment problems at Bank of America, Chase, US Bank and Wells Fargo, to name a few.

question_sentence: Summer is also state fair season. Which state fair is the largest in the US?
evidence: In 2022, the State Fair of Texas welcomed more than 2.5 million visitors through its gates.

question_sentence: A Spanish duke and his wife have triggered controversy by naming their recently christened daughter what?
choices: Zara Bershka Oysho Bimba y Lola Manolo Blahnik Balenciaga Mango
Sofía Fernanda Dolores Cayetana Teresa Ángela de la Cruz Micaela del Santísimo Sacramento del Perpetuo Socorro de la Santísima Trinidad y de Todos Los Santos
Blanco Amarillo Anaranjado Verde Azul Morado
evidence: Fernando Juan Fitz-James Stuart y de Solís, the 17th Duke of Huéscar and his wife, Sofía Palazuelo, have been told that their daughter’s name will need to be shortened in order to be accepted by Spain's Civil Registry. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to the Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: In the first half of 2023, Delaware saw a significant increase in legal abortions compared to 2020. What percentage increase did Delaware experience during this period?
Which sources have been used to track Delaware gas prices and help people find the lowest prices?
choices: Weather forecasts and local news stations

question_sentence: Which 90s pop group reunited on stage for the first time in over a decade at the MTV Video Music Awards?
evidence: All five members of the iconic boy band *NSYNC reunited on stage for the first time since 2013. See the moment here.

question_sentence: Xi Jinping met with Joe Biden in which city during the Chinese leader's first visit to the US in six years?
evidence: The two leaders met on Wednesday on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (Apec) summit, in a bid to stabilise US-China relations. Find out more about why Apec matters with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: How much was spent on legal services by Delaware schools in the last fiscal year, from October 1 to September 30?
In a "world first," a new BMW 5-series sedan will perform what maneuver, using just the driver's eyes?
Which US state became the 24th to legalise recreational marijuana?
evidence: More than 2.1 million Ohio voters, or 57%, this week approved a measure legalising recreational marijuana, defying Republican legislative leaders who had failed to pass the proposed law. The passage of Issue 2 allows adults over the age of 21 to use, purchase and possess the drug for non-medical purposes.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden designated a new national monument this week surrounding which popular tourist destination?
evidence: President Joe Biden on Tuesday designated the fifth national monument of his presidency and unveiled new climate resilience funding for national parks during a visit to lands surrounding one of the seven natural wonders of the world, the Grand Canyon.

question_sentence: What inspired Joshua Sheppard to raise donations for Sean's Room at Saint Mark's High School?
choices: The story of Sean Locke and the SL24 Foundation

question_sentence: The Church of England is selling off what kind of shares to “protect God’s creation”?
evidence: The Church of England is selling its investments in BP, Shell and other oil and gas giants because they do not “protect God’s creation”. Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby, a former oil industry worker, said the climate crisis “threatens the planet we live on”. For 10 things you need to know each day, sign up to the Daily Briefing newsletter.

question_sentence: Three retired US military veterans testified Wednesday at a House hearing on unidentified anomalous phenomena — commonly known as UFOs. Around how many UFO cases is the government tracking?
evidence: The US government is tracking around 650 UFO cases. About half of those are being prioritized for “anomalous interesting value,” according to a Pentagon official.

question_sentence: Which music legend turned 80 this week?
evidence: The Rolling Stones frontman celebrated his 80th birthday, on 26 July, with a star-studded party in London.

question_sentence: What prompted the shooting incident in Wilmington?
choices: A dispute over a stolen vehicle
An argument between a woman, Roderic Grady and another person
A disagreement about a property boundary
A confrontation over a financial transaction

question_sentence: A mysterious upcoming book that became a bestseller amid rumours that it was Taylor Swift’s memoir was actually written by which other music stars?
evidence: The guessing game began last week when the book appeared on multiple bookseller websites under the name 4C Untitled Flatiron Nonfiction Summer 2023. But publishing house Flatiron Books has solved the mystery by revealing that the eagerly anticipated release is about the K-pop boyband and will be published in July under the title Beyond the Story: 10-Year Record of BTS.

question_sentence: Which team was dramatically knocked out of the Women’s World Cup during a penalty shootout against Sweden?
evidence: The US Women’s National Team was shockingly eliminated from the Women’s World Cup in the round-of-16 after losing a penalty shootout against Sweden. It was the earliest exit ever for the two-time reigning champions at the tournament.

question_sentence: What is the name of Omid Scobie's controversial new book about the British royal family?
evidence: Journalist Scobie also co-authored 2020 bestseller "Finding Freedom" about Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. His latest book makes a number of "highly controversial allegations" about the Windsors, said The Daily Telegraph, and promises "details on unsolved mysteries".

question_sentence: What is the current estimated population of adult Atlantic sturgeon breeding in the Delaware River?
King Charles is facing criticism for appointing as head of the royal medical household a doctor who has advocated for what?
evidence: Dr Michael Dixon, "a champion of faith healing and herbalism", has "quietly" held the senior position for the last year, The Sunday Times reported last weekend. Dixon's duties include having overall responsibility for the health of the King and the wider royal family, and potentially even representing them in talks with government.

question_sentence: Which of the following is in critically short supply at US hospitals?
evidence: The US is facing an emergency blood shortage. The American Red Cross said the number of donors has hit a 20-year low amid growing concern the shortage may delay medical procedures.

question_sentence: Vietnam has banned the new Barbie movie over a scene showing what?
choices: A map of disputed Chinese territory
“Made in Vietnam” labels on shoddy clothing
evidence: Vietnam has banned commercial screenings of the Barbie film, out on 21 July, over a map that appears to show Beijing’s “nine-dash line” in the South China Sea that marks disputed territory. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Ten-time NBA All-Star Carmelo Anthony announced his retirement this week. He played for all of these teams, except:
Which popular series is getting a reality show spinoff?
evidence: A reality competition show based on the wildly popular series “Squid Game” will stream on Netflix next month. According to an official synopsis, the series follows 456 contestants who “enter the competition show in pursuit of a life-changing reward of USD $4.56 million.”

question_sentence: Which tropical island faced deadly wildfires this week?
evidence: Dozens of people have died in Maui wildfires that overwhelmed hospitals, demolished homes and destroyed cultural sites.

question_sentence: In protest of the debt limit deal, a group of right-wing House Republicans tanked a vote on GOP-backed legislation addressing:
The shock winner of Argentina’s presidential primary elections, far-right candidate Javier Milei famously claims to be what?
evidence: Javier Milei sent the value of the peso plummeting when he pulled off a landslide win in the primary elections. The far-right economics professor “shot to daytime TV fame” in the 2010s, said The Guardian, as a self-described “tantric sex coach who spoke openly about his preference for threesomes”.

question_sentence: Former President Donald Trump was indicted this week for his alleged efforts to remain in the White House following his 2020 election loss. How many times has Trump been indicted?
evidence: Trump was handed down a third indictment this week, and political analysts say this one may be the most consequential. He was previously indicted for his involvement in a hush-money scheme before he became president and for the alleged mishandling of classified material after he left office.

question_sentence: Cryptocurrency guru Sam Bankman-Fried was convicted of fraud and conspiracy in a scandal that rocked the financial industry. What was the name of his company?
evidence: Bankman-Fried founded the crypto exchange FTX.

question_sentence: Who from Delaware was featured on the Food Network program “Worst Cooks in America” that began airing on Sunday, Jan. 7, 2024?
Which US political figure set off a social media frenzy after sharing details about an experience with “magic mushrooms?”
evidence: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen confirmed in a CNN interview this week that she ate a dish at a restaurant that contained “magic mushrooms” on a recent trip to Beijing, but was unaware the mushrooms had hallucinogenic properties.

question_sentence: What has concerned residents about Noramco's expansion plans?
choices: The company's intention to reduce emissions
The potential release of toxic compounds and hazardous pollution
The lack of response from the Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control (DNREC)
The absence of the environmental justice coordinator

question_sentence: Polling suggests that what percentage of Americans think Joe Biden does not have the “mental sharpness” to serve a second term as president?
evidence: The Washington Post/ABC poll of more than 1,000 people found that 43% believed that 80-year-old Biden and Donald Trump, 76, are both too old to serve another term. If Biden is re-elected in 2024, he would be 82 when he takes office and 86 when his second term ends.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden unveiled new efforts to crack down on which type of fees?
evidence: Biden announced new efforts to crack down on junk fees — the hidden or misleading fees that “companies sneak into your bill to make you pay more,” he said.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden welcomed which world leader to the White House for a state dinner this week?
evidence: Biden hosted Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the White House on Thursday for a lavish, tented state dinner that featured a plant-based menu for the guest of honor, who is a vegetarian.

question_sentence: An EU spat has broken out over Ireland’s plans to label which product with detailed health warnings?
evidence: Ireland will be the first country in the world to mandate labels on alcoholic drinks warning of the risks of cancer and liver disease and of drinking in pregnancy, and listing calorie content and grams of alcohol. EU members including France, Italy and Spain have asked the European Commission to investigate whether the move would contravene EU law.  Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Activists from Just Stop Oil halted an opera performance at Glyndebourne by doing what?
evidence: Three Just Stop Oil protesters interrupted a performance on Thursday of Francis Poulenc’s “Dialogues des Carmélites” at the opera festival, in East Sussex. The performance restarted after a 20-minute delay following the removal of the activists, who were not arrested.
choices: Setting off a confetti bomb and blasting air horns
Loudly singing songs from “Phantom of the Opera”
Doing cartwheels across the stage while naked

question_sentence: Which energy giant has posted record profits of £7.6bn for the first three months of this year?
evidence: The oil and gas company has been accused of a “profiteering bonanza” after making equivalent to £986 per second in the first quarter of 2023, as households struggle with a cost-of-living crisis largely driven by inflated energy bills. BP this week announced profits of £4bn for the same period.

question_sentence: Police Scotland is facing a flood of complaints from officers over a new policy requiring them to do what?
evidence: The Scottish Police Federation, which represents police officers, has reported being “inundated with complaints” over the policy, which the force said was necessary so that staff could wear protective FFP3 masks that require users to be clean-shaven. Four officers are reportedly taking legal action in relation to the rule, due to come into effect on 29 May.

question_sentence: Which political figure tested positive for Covid-19 this week?
evidence: First lady Jill Biden tested positive for Covid-19 this week and is experiencing “mild symptoms,” the White House said. President Joe Biden has tested negative.

question_sentence: Which day this week marked the unofficial end of summer?
evidence: Labor Day on Monday marked the unofficial end of summer for many in the US — but forecasts show that July-like heat will continue building across several states in the coming weeks.

question_sentence: Which tech leader met with Israel’s president this week?
evidence: Elon Musk visited Israel Monday, meeting the country’s leaders as he tried to calm the outrage caused by his endorsement of an antisemitic post on his social media platform, X.

question_sentence: Which car company has publicly criticised Rishi Sunak’s decision to delay the UK’s 2030 ban on new petrol and diesel cars?
evidence: The company’s UK chair, Lisa Brankin, said the 2030 target had been a "vital catalyst to accelerate Ford into a cleaner future“. Pushing back the non-electric car ban to 2035 would “undermine” the government’s “ambition, commitment and consistency”, Brankin warned.

question_sentence: Which England football player scored twice in Tuesday’s 6-1 win against China at the Women’s World Cup?
evidence: The Lionesses secured a place in the last 16 of the tournament, taking place in Australia and New Zealand, with goals by Chelsea forward James, Alessia Russo, Lauren Hemp, Chloe Kelly and Rachel Daly.

question_sentence: What percentage of UK adults believe that refugees make a “positive contribution” to society, according to an Ipsos survey?
evidence: The survey of 22,000 adults in 29 countries found that Brits had the third most positive attitude to refugees, after Spain and New Zealand. The global average of adults who believe refugees make a “positive contribution” was 45%.

question_sentence: NASA this week announced the names of the astronauts who will be sent on a historic journey around the moon next year aboard the Artemis II rocket. How many astronauts were selected to join the mission?
evidence: Four astronauts, including three Americans and one Canadian, will be the first crew sent to orbit the moon since the Apollo program ended more than 50 years ago.

question_sentence: What is the primary issue discussed in the article " 'Beats living on the streets:' The Delawareans who call motels home during the holidays"?
choices: The challenges faced by individuals living in motels during the holidays, including lack of housing options.
The efforts of outreach groups to provide food, clothing, and toys to motel residents during the holidays.
The specific circumstances of Cheryl Dayton, a motel resident, and her transition to affordable housing.
The impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on America's housing crisis.

question_sentence: Which Supreme Court justice received sharp criticism for not disclosing luxury trips funded by a Republican megadonor?
evidence: Some Democrats have called for the impeachment of Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas following a bombshell report that detailed lavish trips paid for by a billionaire real estate magnate, which included traveling on his yacht and private jet.

question_sentence: Billie Eilish accused which publication of "outing" her?
evidence: Eilish has called for an end to speculation about her sexuality that began when the "Bad Guy" singer suggested during a recent interview for Variety that she was attracted to women. After then being asking at Variety's Hitmakers event whether she had intended to come out, Eilish sarcastically thanked the magazine in an Instagram post for "outing" her "instead of talking about anything else that matters".

question_sentence: Which state deployed more than 200 law enforcement personnel this week to capture an escaped prisoner?
evidence: Convicted murderer Danelo Cavalcante escaped a Pennsylvania prison on August 31, sparking a dayslong manhunt. The search for him unnerved residents statewide who were warned that he was extremely dangerous.

question_sentence: Why did ShopRite stores in Delaware return to full-service checkout with cashiers?
choices: Because they wanted to speed up the checkout process.
Because they experienced a labor shortage.

question_sentence: Which European royal announced their surprise abdication in a New Year's Eve speech?
evidence: The world's only reigning queen and Europe's longest-serving monarch said she would step down on 14 January – 52 years to the day since she became monarch following the death of her father, King Frederik IX. The throne will go to her 55-year-old son, Crown Prince Frederik.

question_sentence: An activist is to be prosecuted for contempt of court for holding up a sign outside the trial of protesters from which climate group?
evidence: Civil liberties campaigners said the decision to prosecute retired social worker Trudi Warner for holding up a sign allegedly directed at jurors was part of the government's crackdown on the right to protest. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which state is adding more homeless people every year than any other state in the US?
evidence: Half of all Americans living outside on the streets live in California. More than 170,000 unhoused people currently live in the state — and that figure is growing, federal data shows.

question_sentence: A revised red, white and blue flag honoring Juneteenth was introduced in 2000. What symbol is at the center of the flag?
evidence: The flag, created by activist Ben Haith, founder of the National Juneteenth Celebration Foundation, has a white star in the middle representing the Lone Star State of Texas as well as the freedom of African Americans in all 50 states.

question_sentence: A bicorne hat worn by Napoleon Bonaparte sold for how much at a Paris auction this week?
evidence: The faded black felt hat, which was valued between €600,000 and €800,000, was the centrepiece of an auction of the 19th century French emperor's belongings. The price surpassed the €1.8 million paid for another of his hats in 2014.

question_sentence: Which singer-songwriter got an on-stage spooky surprise when a keyboard began playing by itself during a gig?
evidence: The chart-topper was visibly shaken when her keyboard began playing notes by itself during the Era Tour show in Massachusetts. Swift subsequently explained that the seemingly possessed instrument had malfunctioned after being damaged by rain during a previous concert.

question_sentence: What viral term describes scheduling multiple dates in one day?
evidence: A Sunday Times journalist recently faced a backlash for trying out a viral dating trend known as “date stacking”, or scheduling multiple dates in a day. Find out more about the trend in The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which US institution this week released its first-ever code of conduct?
evidence: The most powerful legal body in the US has issued ethics rules governing its nine justices amid increasing scrutiny following reports of undisclosed property deals and gifts. In a one-sentence press release, the court said the code was merely the "codification of principles that we have long regarded as governing our conduct".

question_sentence: Which airline this week said it will begin weighing some passengers before they board the airplane?
evidence: Some international travelers leaving Auckland International Airport will soon be asked to step on the scale to help gather data on the weight load and distribution for Air New Zealand planes, the airline said.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden made an extraordinary wartime visit this week to which country?
evidence: President Biden visited Israel in a dramatic show of support for the country as it works to eliminate Hamas, the Islamist group that controls Gaza.

question_sentence: Which public figure is gearing up to launch a 2024 presidential campaign in a matter of days?
evidence: Former Vice President Mike Pence will launch his 2024 presidential campaign on June 7 with an announcement video and a speech in Iowa, two sources familiar with the plans tell CNN.

question_sentence: The federal government's COVID-19 national public health emergency formally came to an end this week. When was it first declared?
Who will the University of Delaware’s first game as a member of the NCAA Division I Football Bowl Subdivision in 2025 be against?
Which unlikely trade is reportedly losing jobs to AI bots?
evidence: The jobs of clairvoyants, fortune tellers and traditional mystics are being taken over by AI bots, in “a bleak future they did not see coming”, said the Daily Star. Artificial intelligence mediums apparently use algorithms to divine the customer’s future. For more strange and unlikely stories, sign up to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Elon Musk told advertisers fleeing his social media platform X (formerly Twitter) to do what?
evidence: X and Tesla owner Musk overshadowed this week's release of his much-hyped Cybertruck by lashing out at major advertisers who have fled his social media platform over antisemitic content. During an interview at The New York Times DealBook conference on Wednesday, the billionaire claimed the boycott was going to "kill the company".

question_sentence: Federal prosecutors this week charged Rep. George Santos with which of the following:
What is the name of the new Covid variant triggering a surge of infections in India?
evidence: Omicron subvariant Arcturus was first detected in late January and is being monitored by the World Health Organization as a variant of concern. Cases have been reported in at least 27 countries, including the UK.

question_sentence: What is the age limit for individuals to participate in virtual auditions for the upcoming season of "American Idol"?
A sample from the surface of near-Earth asteroid Bennu has been found to contain an abundance of what?
evidence: The initial findings on the 4.5 billion-year-old asteroid sample, which was parachuted into the Utah desert in a cannister last month, reinforce the theory that life on Earth was seeded from outer space. Offering a first look at the ancient black dust and chunks, Nasa administrator Bill Nelson told media at the Johnson Space Center in Houston that "this is the biggest carbon-rich asteroid sample ever returned to Earth”.

question_sentence: What percentage of people in the UK have a strong interest in the news, according to a new study?
evidence: A global study by researchers at Oxford University’s Reuters Institute found that worldwide, 48% of people were very or extremely interested in the news – down from 63% in 2017. The proportion was even lower in the UK, as audiences “cut back on depressing news” to protect their mental health, said the study authors.

question_sentence: Australia beat England by two wickets in a thrilling first Test of the men’s Ashes series that was played where?
evidence: Australia gained revenge for their agonising two-run Ashes defeat at the Birmingham ground in 2005 on Tuesday, when their fast-bowler captain Pat Cummins led his side to improbable victory with an unbeaten 44.

question_sentence: Which late celebrity is being "brought back to life" using AI in order to narrate a biopic?
evidence: Warner Music Group has announced that artificial intelligence will be used to recreate the "voice and image" of the "La Vie en Rose" singer, who died in 1963, for the upcoming 90-minute biopic. Titled "Edith", the film is billed to tell the story of how she became “a symbol of female empowerment and one of France's most iconic artists of all time”.

question_sentence: What was the main reason behind Incyte's decision not to move forward with its headquarters expansion in Alapocas?
choices: Denial of critical variances by the New Castle County Board of Adjustment

question_sentence: The daughter of late NHS fundraiser Captain Sir Tom Moore was ordered to demolish what unauthorised structure in her garden?
evidence: Hannah Ingram-Moore and her husband were granted permission to build an office in the grounds of their Bedfordshire home, to be used partly “in connection with the Captain Tom Foundation and its charitable objectives”, but then added a pool building and applied for retrospective permission. They have now been ordered to demolish the pool spa complex after the retrospective application was denied.

question_sentence: Manufacturer Reckitt Benckiser recalled which product from sale this week over contamination fears?
evidence: Reckitt Benckiser said it was voluntarily recalling 675,000 cans of Nutramigen Powder, a hypoallergenic formula sold in the US and UK, as a "precautionary step" owing to a "possibility of contamination" with Cronobacter sakazakii. The bacteria can cause the potentially fatal infections sepsis and meningitis, but the company said that no "illnesses or adverse events" linked to the products had been reported.

question_sentence: Which country won the 2023 Eurovision Song Contest?
evidence: Sweden’s Loreen won the crowd-pleasing show held in Liverpool, United Kingdom, on behalf of Ukraine. She became just the second performer to win the competition more than once.

question_sentence: Who beat 16-year-old darts prodigy Luke Littler to become the PDC world champion?
evidence: British teen Littler, nicknamed "The Nuke", defeated former world No.1s Cross and van Gerwen to become the youngest-ever world championship finalist, before losing to Humphries. The 28-year-old new world champ took five consecutive sets to win 7-4 at London's Alexandra Palace on Wednesday.

question_sentence: Which North African country was inundated with catastrophic flooding this week?
evidence: More than 5,000 people have died in eastern Libya this week due to flash flooding, according to government and hospital officials. Around 10,000 others are believed to be missing.

question_sentence: Hundreds of foreigners were allowed to leave Gaza this week for the first time since the Israel-Hamas war began. To which country did they flee?
evidence: Injured Palestinians and hundreds of foreign nationals have started crossing from Gaza into Egypt, officials and Egyptian media said, in the first sanctioned exodus from the besieged enclave in weeks.

question_sentence: What is the name of the Delaware roadside restaurant that Chris Taggart and Brian Kirwin acquired three years ago this December?
choices: The Charcoal Pit on Concord Pike
The Dog House at 200 N. Dupont Highway
Tom Jones Diner in Brookhaven, Pennsylvania
US Foods, an American food service distributor

question_sentence: Elon Musk said he’s cut approximately how much of Twitter’s staff?
evidence: Elon Musk has laid off more than 6,000 people at Twitter since taking over the company, he said in an interview this week. The reduction equates to roughly 80% of the company’s staff.

question_sentence: The Italian town of Portofino is banning tourists from doing what?
choices: Taking alcoholic drinks into the sea
evidence: The Italian Riviera town is introducing fines of up to €275 for loitering in designated no-waiting zones, in a bid to prevent street blockages caused by tourists taking snaps and selfies.

question_sentence: After 35 years, the curtain fell for the final time on Broadway's longest-running musical this week. What is the show called?
What is one of the reasons cited by Delmarva Power for requesting the rate increase?
choices: Recent high inflation and increased repair costs caused by severe weather events.
To provide a bonus to employees for their hard work.

question_sentence: Which Republican was elected as the new House speaker on Wednesday?
evidence: After weeks of party infighting, Louisiana Rep. Mike Johnson secured the speaker’s gavel without losing any Republican votes.

question_sentence: Which of the following politicians is not a candidate in Taiwan's upcoming presidential election?
evidence: Opposition politicians Hou and Ko and current vice president Lai are battling to replace Tsai, who is due to step down after completing two terms as president. The outcome of the election, on 13 January, will have major implications for both domestic and global politics, as Beijing reiterates China's claim to the island.

question_sentence: What addition is Capriotti's making to its legendary flagship sandwich, The Bobbie, for the first time?
choices: Offering a hot version of The Bobbie
Selling side dishes of mashed red potatoes and gravy to go with The Bobbie
Introducing a vegetarian version of The Bobbie

question_sentence: This year’s Super Bowl marked the first time that two brothers faced off against each other in the big game. Which NFL teams do Travis Kelce and Jason Kelce play for?
evidence: Travis Kelce plays tight end for the Chiefs and Jason Kelce is a center for the Eagles. Kansas City beat Philadelphia 38-35 in Super Bowl LVII.

question_sentence: What is the name of the anthem composed by Andrew Lloyd Webber for the King’s coronation?
evidence: The composer’s coronation anthem will be played publicly for the first time as King Charles III is crowned in Westminster Abbey on Saturday.  According to Lloyd Webber, the monarch requested that the tune be “hummable” and cheerful because “he wants the anthem sung in churches”.

question_sentence: Months after Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas came under scrutiny for accepting lavish trips paid for by a billionaire Republican donor, another justice is in the spotlight for similar reasons. Which justice is it?
evidence: Concerns about ethics and transparency at the Supreme Court have been reignited this week after Justice Samuel Alito acknowledged attending a luxury fishing trip on the private jet of a conservative hedge fund manager.

question_sentence: What will be the leading cause of cancer in women under 60 by 2030, according to a new study?
evidence: According to forecasts by Cancer Research UK, obesity will overtake smoking as the leading cause of cancer among women under 60 by 2030. The UK is "reaping the consequences" of a government failure to tackle rising rates of people being overweight and obese, said Katharine Jenner, director of the Obesity Health Alliance.

question_sentence: Uber released its annual list of items forgotten by passengers in cars. Which city took the top spot for being the most forgetful?
evidence: Jacksonville, Florida, had the most forgotten items, including phones, wallets, keys, jewelry and headphones, according to Uber’s report. San Antonio, Texas, and Palm Springs, California, took the second and third spots, respectively.

question_sentence: What is the name of the dog mentioned in the article who spent 942 days at a shelter before being permanently adopted?
Newly released Metropolitan Police figures show that one in every how many officers in the force are currently suspended or on restricted duties?
evidence: The Met has a total of around 34,000 officers, 201 of whom are suspended, while 860 are on restricted duties. The London force said that 450 officers were under investigation for alleged sexual or domestic violence, and that 275 were already awaiting gross misconduct hearings, amid a crackdown on rogue officers.

question_sentence: Which type of product was recently distributed to some US stores despite a recall notice?
evidence: A Gerber baby formula was distributed to stores despite a recall over possible contamination, according to the FDA. The company is encouraging parents to check any products they have at home and discard those that may be affected.

question_sentence: Which major pharmacy chain filed for bankruptcy this week?
evidence: Rite Aid filed for bankruptcy after losing nearly $3 billion over the past six years.

question_sentence: The US and which other country this week launched their largest joint military drills in decades in the South China Sea?
evidence: More than 17,600 military personnel are taking part in drills including live-fire exercises and a boat-sinking rocket assault, amid fears that China may be preparing to launch an offensive against Taiwan.

question_sentence: What is the name of the hurricane threatening to dump heavy rain on parts of California and the Southwest?
evidence: Hilary is forecast to intensify into a Category 4 hurricane with winds of at least 130 mph before weakening significantly as it potentially reaches Southern California and parts of the Southwest this weekend.

question_sentence: Which toy will no longer be sold by Amazon, Target and Walmart due to safety concerns?
evidence: Major retailers have voluntarily stopped selling water beads marketed for children. Water beads are tiny balls made out of extremely absorbent polymer material that can expand up to 100 times their size when exposed to liquid. Health experts say they can cause intestinal blockages if injested.

question_sentence: Which food chain is launching a legal battle after being refused a 24-hour licence at its Leicester Square store?
evidence: The British bakery chain is set for a courtroom showdown with Westminster Council after being denied permission  to sell hot food at its flagship London outlet after 11pm..The application was rejected last year after police warned that selling late-night sausage rolls risked fuelling “crime and disorder”.

question_sentence: South Carolina star Aliyah Boston was the first pick in this week’s WNBA Draft. In total, how many South Carolina players were drafted Monday?
What is the primary focus of the Brandywine River Restoration Trust's mission?
choices: Promoting local sources of water and tap water
Cleaning up water in the Brandywine and educating underserved communities about contaminated water
Analyzing rainfall data for real-time updates on river water quality

question_sentence: Which lawmaker announced that he is leaving Congress at the end of this year?
evidence: Former House Speaker Kevin McCarthy is resigning from Congress and will leave at the end of this year, he announced in a Wall Street Journal op-ed this week.

question_sentence: What percentage of 16- to 18-year-olds believe the world is “likely” to end in their lifetimes because of climate change, according to a newly published poll?
evidence: Of more than 1,000 sixth-form pupils surveyed by think-tank Civitas, 26% also said that climate change had made their anxiety or sadness worse. And half said that people should have fewer children in order to tackle climate change and overpopulation.

question_sentence: Which automaker reached a tentative agreement with unionized workers to end a bruising strike?
evidence: More than 16,000 autoworkers are set to return to their jobs after the United Auto Workers union and Ford reached a tentative deal to end a strike.

question_sentence: Finland became the 31st member of NATO this week. Which country does Finland share a border with?
Which major US city is sinking under the weight of its skyscrapers?
evidence: According to a new study by the US Geological Survey (USGS), New York is sinking by 1-2mm per year, in part owing to the enormous weight of the city’s buildings, which total an estimated 771 million tonnes. The researchers also blamed other phenomena including groundwater withdrawal and shifting tectonic plates.

question_sentence: Which athlete shattered the women's marathon record last Sunday in Berlin while wearing new £400 "super shoes"?
evidence: Ethiopia's Assefa crossed the line in two hours, 11 minutes and 53 seconds, knocking more than two minutes off the previous record set by Kenya's Brigid Kosgei in 2019. Only 48 hours later, Adidas put the Adizero Adios Pro Evo 1 trainers on the market – only for the stock to sell out within hours.

question_sentence: Which Fox News host parted ways with the network this week?
evidence: Fox News announced the prime-time host’s abrupt departure on Monday, less than a week after agreeing to pay $787.5m to settle a defamation case in which Carlson played a starring role.

question_sentence: What was the location of the unauthorized car meet where a shooting occurred?
Where is the global COP28 climate summit being held?
evidence: Tens of thousands of people are heading to Dubai for COP28, the annual international climate summit convened by the United Nations.

question_sentence: About 1 in 4 people in the US live with air pollution that can hurt their health, according to a new report. Which region has the most ozone-polluted cities?
evidence: Residents of Western cities are disproportionately affected, according to a new report from the American Lung Association. California had 10 of the 25 most ozone-polluted cities. New York, Chicago and Hartford, Connecticut, were the only three on the list east of the Mississippi River.

question_sentence: What was the name of the suspect arrested in connection with the Dover ambush shootings that killed one and injured three?
Which US congressman this week announced his decision to retire from Congress at the end of this year "to serve America in new ways"?
evidence: The California Republican announced his resignation in a newspaper column on Wednesday, two months after becoming the first House speaker in history to be ousted from the role. The imminent departure of McCarthy from Congress, after 17 years in office, will leave his party with a slim 220-213 majority in the chamber.

question_sentence: Marks & Spencer, WHSmith and Argos are among 202 companies fined a total of around £7 million for failing to do what?
evidence: The firms were also ordered to repay a total of around £5 million in lost wages to 63,000 staff, following investigations by HMRC dating back to 2017. M&S, WHSmith and Argos all said the breaches were unintentional and had been swiftly remedied.

question_sentence: Summer is peak season for amusement parks. Where was America’s first roller coaster built?
evidence: The first roller coaster in America opened on Coney Island, in Brooklyn, New York, in 1884.

question_sentence: Netflix recently released a trailer for the second season of which hit show?
evidence: Netflix has shared exclusive new details for the second season of its runaway hit “Squid Game,” the South Korean thriller series in which contestants who are deeply in debt play children’s games in order to win a ton of cash — with the losers getting killed.

question_sentence: Which GOP lawmaker called for a formal impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden?
evidence: McCarthy has called for a formal impeachment inquiry into Biden amid pressure from conservatives, even as they have yet to prove allegations he directly profited off his son’s foreign business deals.

question_sentence: What percentage of the world’s population is affected by infertility, according to research from the World Health Organization (WHO)?
evidence: In the WHO’s first estimates of infertility prevalence in more than a decade, it was found that about 17.5% of the global adult population will experience infertility. Based on more than 100 studies between 1990 and 2021, the results show limited variation between regions and between high, middle and low-income countries. “For millions around the world, the path to parenthood can be difficult to access, if not impossible,” said Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the WHO director general.

question_sentence: ESPN apologized for airing footage during the broadcast of a game between the Miami Heat and the New York Knicks that showed what?
The US government is opening a public portal for Americans to report which kind of sightings?
evidence: The Pentagon is preparing for a flood of new reports as it readies two new portals for sightings of unidentified anomalous phenomena, more commonly known as UFOs.

question_sentence: Rishi Sunak has faced scrutiny as a subject of how many investigations or probes in the past year?
evidence: The prime minister is under investigation by Parliament’s sleaze watchdog over allegations of a possible failure to declare shares held by his wife in a childcare agency boosted by the recent Budget. Sunak has also faced scrutiny over issues including his wife’s non-dom tax status, his US green card and his dog-walking habits.

question_sentence: Secretary of State Antony Blinken traveled to which country this week in an effort to “stabilize” relations?
evidence: Blinken traveled to China for meetings with top officials, including President Xi Jinping. Blinken is the first US secretary of state to visit Beijing in five years, and his talks were seen as a key litmus test for whether the two governments can stop relations from continuing to deteriorate at a time of lingering distrust.

question_sentence: North Korea's Kim Jong Un is believed to have celebrated which big birthday this week?
evidence: Kim Jong Un is believed to have been born on 8 January 1984, although North Korea has never confirmed the exact date. He has been supreme leader of the hermit state since the death of his father, Kim Jong Il, in 2011.

question_sentence: Which state is investigating robotaxi collisions after a handful of incidents recently endangered pedestrians?
evidence: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration and California investigators have opened a probe into whether General Motors’ self-driving vehicles are safe around pedestrians.

question_sentence: Roughly how many student loan borrowers recently received inaccurate bills?
evidence: The Department of Education announced about 300,000 student loan borrowers recently got monthly bills with the wrong amount — many with charges higher than they should be.
